title: Patient Handoff (Handover) Education: Mobile Microlearning Based on Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical communication skills and understanding of patient care protocols
context.additional_context: Mobile learning optimized for smartphone-based environments, focusing on cognitive load management strategies in complex work settings. Composed of 15-minute daily modular content with formative assessment systems enabling real-time feedback

learning_goals: Learners can identify and manage at least three types of intrinsic cognitive load occurring during the handoff process.
Learners can perform efficient patient handoffs within 10 minutes using structured communication tools (e.g., SBAR).
Learners achieve over 90% accuracy in microlearning modules based on real clinical scenarios.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
